page.title: 17THE MAYORAL PROCESSION
page.content: On several Sundays in the year, the {Mayor and members of Council}attend morning service at All Saints Parish Church. This happens on Remembrance Sunday, after they have paraded along the High Street. The{procession}is very colourful and dates back to 16th century. They used to walk in this order.{The Beadle}with the the staff leads followed with two{Bailiffs with white staves. Then came the {sergeant at-mace,}carrying a large silver mace gilded with gold. Next came the{Mayor,}carrying a silver mace gilded with gold, followed by the{High {Steward}and recorder and, at the rear in twos the{Aldermen}in the order of service time. Finally, came the{Town {Clerk}and the{Burgesses}in twos. The procession has changed a little over the years.
